name: LGBTQ History and Culture Since 1940 (Gale)
description: Archives of Human Sexuality and Identity: LGBTQ History and Culture Since 1940 presents a range of documents drawn from numerous collections, presenting important aspects of LGBTQ life in the second half of the twentieth century and beyond. In addition to manuscript materials relating to LGBTQ individuals and organizations, the archive includes gay and lesbian newspapers from more than 35 countries, reports, policy statements, and other documents related to gay rights and health, including the worldwide impact of AIDS, and materials tracing LGBTQ activism in Britain from 1950 through 1980, along with extensive material related to feminism, womenÛªs rights, and womenÛªs concerns. *** This database is currently in a trial period. Please send feedback about this database to jill.conte@nyu.edu ***
